details.description:
For the last six years Kathryn has been an independent digital communications consultant and trainer working with the likes of McCann Erickson, the British Council, Microsoft, Emarketeers, Technology Strategy Board and Mastercard; and has advised numerous technology start-ups. Kathryn has a passion for the impact technology can make on society. Whilst online manager of the New Statesman from 2001 to 2006, she ran the magazine’s New Media Awards and their social enterprise Upstart Awards. In 2009 she organised the Digital Britain Unconferences: a UK wide, volunteer led, grassroots response to the UK government’s Digital Britain Interim Report. And in2010 Kathryn helped launch the Open Knowledge Foundation project Where Does My Money Go? which has gone on to become Open Spending.

In addition to her consulting, Kathryn is Journalist in Residence at Kingston University and has been a visiting lecturer at the University of East Anglia, Bournemouth University and Ravensbourne. She is chair of the Online News Association in the UK, an associate professional member of the Chartered Institute of Marketers and member of the Democratic Society. She is a regular public speaker, keen photographer and early in 2012 qualified as a level 1 ski instructor.
